business.headline: Unified Pension Scheme to roll out from April 1. Check eligibility and benefitsUnder the new pension scheme, government employees will contribute 10% of their basic salary along with DA, while the government's contribution will rise from the previous 14% to 18.5%.

ELSS explained: Check tax benefits under Section 80C and other key details ELSS offers market-linked returns and has the potential to generate higher long-term returns as compared to other Section 80C options, including PPF, ULIPS, and NPS, etc.

Trump's reciprocal tariffs could hurt Indian exports. Which sectors are at risk?While officials are still waiting for details on how these tariffs will be calculated, they are already preparing countermeasures and working on a trade deal proposal to reduce tariffs and boost two-way trade.

Want to save taxes? Try these 5 last-minute investment options to maximise benefitsThe Equity-Linked Savings Scheme (ELSS) is a popular tax-saving tool available under Section 80C, offering a lock-in period of three years. Under this, investments up to Rs 1.5 lakh are eligible for deductions.

Sugar gets costlier: Prices rise 6.5% in a month as output dipsSugar price hike: A drop in sugar output, caused by adverse weather and the reopening of sugar exports after two years, has led to a supply shortage, pushing up prices.

New Income Tax Bill: Will taxpayers with late ITR filings lose refunds?Late ITR filing refund concern: The Income Tax Act, 1961, does not prevent taxpayers from claiming a refund just because the return was filed after the deadline.

Licious, backed by Temasek, preps for massive $2 billion IPO: Report Delightful Gourmet Pvt, the parent company of Licious, is expanding its physical store network and improving delivery times to compete with quick-commerce rivals.

Smallcap stocks are bleeding. What should investors do?Smallcap stocks have been battered by the persistent selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs). A dismal Q3 earnings season has only worsened the situation.

Indian Overseas Bank rolls out Aadhaar-based account opening. Check detailsThis new initiative allows customers to open savings bank accounts online with minimal documentation, as per Reserve Bank of India's eKYC guidelines.

Dalal Street volatile: The S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.65 points to settle at 75,996.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.25 points to close at 22,959.50. Despite this recovery, overall market sentiment remains cautious as investors react to various global and domestic factors.

How a change of name caused Bira a loss of Rs 80 crore. Check details Ahead of its IPO, B9 Beverages Private Ltd, the owner of Bira beer, changed its name to B9 Beverages Ltd, causing several compliance hurdles and sales disruptions.

New Income Tax Bill: 10 FAQs you should knowNew Income Tax Bill 2025 explained: The current income tax bill which was enacted in 1961, and came into effect in 1962, consisted of 512,535 words and 819 sections. On the contrary, the new bill consists of 259,676 words, 23 chapters and 536 sections.
Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end marginally higher amid volatilityThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.65 points to close at 75,996.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.25 points to end at 22,959.50.

Regulatory body warns against rising NPS scams, issues these guidelines The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has cautioned subscribers of the National Pension Scheme (NPS) and Atal Pension Yojayna (APY) regarding fraudulent calls demanding money to release pension funds.

Government may set up reserve fund for stable EPFO interest rates: ReportThe labour and employment ministry is conducting an internal study to explore the creation of an interest stabilisation reserve fund under the EPFO, sources said familiar with the matter.

Is your money safe in co-operative banks safe? RBI's latest curbs raise concernConcerns over New India Co-operative Bank's financial stability and a potential Rs 122 crore scam prompted the RBI to take strict action. India Inc sees worst quarter in 5 years: What it means for stock market? The recently concluded Q3 earnings season has been the weakest for India Inc since the first quarter of FY21, according to a report by domestic brokerage firm Motilal Oswal.

general news.headline: 5 arrested after protests over Nepal student suicide at Bhubaneswar universityFive officials, including two security guards, were arrested in connection with the alleged suicide of Nepali student Prakriti Lamsal at KIIT, Bhubaneswar. Mamata Banerjee's 'mrityu kumbh' remark stokes row, BJP hits backA political showdown erupted on Monday after West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday referred to the Maha Kumbh Mela as 'Mrityu Kumbh (Kumbh of Death)' over the stampede deaths. US, Russia appoint teams to work on ending Ukraine war 'as soon as possible'The United States and Russia began discussions to address bilateral tensions and work towards ending the war in Ukraine, with both sides appointing teams to pursue a sustainable resolution, though the effort is still in its early stages.

But is it the only agency that is to be blamed for failing to prevent the tragedy or is there a bigger question of intelligence failure and local police inaction? How far is the Railways enabled, technically and manpower-wise, to prevent such tragedies?

Rizwan attended the press conference before Pakistan's clash against New Zealand in Karachi.

IND vs PAK is a great thing for javelin: Neeraj on rivalry with Arshad NadeemNeeraj Chopra is glad that India vs Pakistan rivalry in javelin is taking the sport to different heights alltogther. Neeraj and Arshad shared two spots in the Paris Olympics podium in 2024.

Babar Azam is the right man to open in Champions Trophy: Rizwan Champions Trophy 2025: Mohammad Rizwan said that Babar Azam would open the batting in the mega event. Babar has only 88 runs to his name as an ODI opener at an average of 17.60.

Bombay High Court rules in favour of BCCI in Tax Exemption CaseThe Bombay High Court has quashed an Income Tax Department advisory questioning BCCI's tax-exempt status, ruling that any decision regarding its exemption must follow due statutory process rather than relying on non-statutory communication from tax authorities.

BCCI allows families to attend one match in Dubai, prior permission neededThe Indian cricket board has allowed families and partners of cricketers to watch one match of the Champions Trophy 2025. However, the players will need to inform the BCCI and seek permission from them prior to the game.

Flick defends VAR after Barcelona return to top of LaLiga with controversial winFC Barcelona regained the lead in LaLiga with a controversial 1-0 win over Rayo Vallecano. Barcelona coach reacted to a contensious decision by VAR which helped Barcelona sneak a win and wipe out their point-difference against bitter rivals Real Madrid.

Champions Trophy history: 8 editions, 7 champions in Mini World Cup's wild journeyChampions Trophy 2025: No other tournament in cricket history has faced as many threats of being scrapped, but the Champions Trophy has survived multiple deliberations to return to the ICC calendar after an eight-year gap -- the longest between two editions of the ODI tournament.

Mission 90m is on: Neeraj Chopra on how legend Zelezny is moulding his techniqueDouble Olympic medallist Neeraj Chopra is working with his new coach Jan Zelezny. The legendary former javelin star has been working on correcting Neeraj's technique post the Paris Olympics.

Champions Trophy: New Zealand name Jamieson as Lockie Ferguson's replacementChampions Trophy 2025: New Zealand suffered another setback as Lockie Ferguson was ruled out of the Champions Trophy due to injury, with Kyle Jamieson named as his replacement. The Black Caps now await further updates on Rachin Ravindra's fitness.

Watch: Rohit featured in his 17th ICC photoshoot, wows Jadeja and GillIndia captain Rohit Sharma stunned teammates Ravindra Jadeja and Shubman Gill as he recalled his 17 ICC tournament appearances ahead of the Champions Trophy, highlighting his immense experience and impressive record in global events.

India bowling coach Morne Morkel returns home due to family emergencyChampions Trophy: India bowling coach Morne Morkel has rushed out of Dubai due to a family emergency. Morkel left for South Africa after his father Albert passed away. Morkel was expected to play a crucial part in guiding India's bowling attack in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah.

Mission 90m is on: Neeraj Chopra on how legend Zelezny is moulding his techniqueDouble Olympic medallist Neeraj Chopra is working with his new coach Jan Zelezny. The legendary former javelin star has been working on correcting Neeraj's technique post the Paris Olympics.

The Black Caps now await further updates on Rachin Ravindra's fitness.

India bowling coach Morne Morkel returns home due to family emergencyChampions Trophy: India bowling coach Morne Morkel has rushed out of Dubai due to a family emergency. Morkel left for South Africa after his father Albert passed away. Morkel was expected to play a crucial part in guiding India's bowling attack in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah.

Hosting CWG would be a stepping stone for India's Olympic Dream: CGF CEO SadlierCommonwealth Games Federation CEO Katie Sadleir has said that hosting the CWG 2030 would be the right step in India's hope of hosting the Olympics. India have formally submitted the bid for the 2036 Games and hope to host the event across multiple cities.

Watch: Rohit, Kohli relax after nets, Shami signs autographs for fansIndia skipper Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli were spotted unwinding after a training session in Dubai ahead of the Champions Trophy, while pacer Mohammed Shami delighted fans by taking time to sign autographs.

Mary Kom presents Manu Bhaker with BBC Sportswoman of the year awardIndian boxing legend Mary Kom presented the BBC Indian Sportswoman of the Year award to Paris Olympics shooting sensation Manu Bhaker on February 17, honouring her remarkable achievements, including two historic bronze medals at the Games, solidifying her legacy in Indian sports.

Virat Kohli will perform like a champion: Childhood coach backs India starChampions Trophy: Virat Kohli's childhood coach, Rajkumar Sharma, has dismissed concerns over the star batter's form, backing him to deliver a "champion" performance in the upcoming Champions Trophy despite recent struggles in international cricket.

Novak Djokovic calls out 'favouritism' shown in Jannik Sinner doping banNovak Djokovic slammed WADA for showing "favouritism" in Jannik Sinner's doping case, criticising the lenient three-month ban that allows the World No.1 to compete in Grand Slams, calling it unfair treatment compared to other doping cases.

Why vice-captain Shubman Gill will be India's MVP in Champions TrophyVice-captain Shubman Gill has stepped up in ODIs for India in a big way in the past few years and could prove to be India's MVP during the upcoming Champions Trophy in Dubai.

Manu Bhaker named BBC Sportswoman of the YearManu Bhaker, India's shooting sensation, won the BBC Indian Sportswoman of the Year after securing two historic bronze medals at the Paris Olympics, becoming the first Indian female shooter to achieve multiple Olympic podium finishes.

Raina reveals masterstroke which helped India win Champions Trophy 2013Former India cricketer Suresh Raina revealed India's masterstroke which helped them emerge victorious in the ICC Champions Trophy 2013 under the leadership of MS Dhoni.

Captain, star batter, and now coach: Smriti Mandhana juggles roles in WPL 2025Royal Challengers Bengaluru women opener Danielle Wyatt Hodge credited her captain Smriti Mandhana for coaching her during their match winning century partnership against Delhi Capitals (DC-W) in Women's Premier League.

Rajesh Kannur: India's homeless cricket hero dreams of a better futureRajesh Kannur, who won the Player of the Tournament award after India's triumph in the Physical Disability Champions Trophy in Sri Lanka earlier this year, spoke to India Today, calling for support. The cricketer has battled against the odds to pursue his passion and dreams of building a home for his family in a better future.

Fiery Smriti Mandhana and bowlers help RCB hammer DC, top table earlyWPL 2025, RCB vs DC: Smriti Mandhana smashed a 47-ball 81 as Royal Challengers Bengaluru chased 142 in just 16.2 overs. With two wins in as many matches, RCB are on top of the points table early in the season.

40-year-old Afghan star dreams of playing with son, hints at extending career Champions Trophy 2025: Mohammad Nabi, who had announced last year that he would retire from ODIs after the tournament, has now hinted at extending his 50-over career. Nabi revealed that his dream is to play for Afghanistan alongside his 18-year-old son, Hassan Eisakhil.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
